body:
I complied `.py` files to `.so` files using cython's cythonize function.
And found the code line number in logging informations are wrong.

For example, I have the following code structure.

```
web
├── boot.so
├── handlers.so
├── __init__.py
├── __init__.so
├── server.py
└── server.so
```

The logging data is like these:

```
INFO: 2018-04-17 13:05:47: web.py:1510 * 140329485150016 Get next question of step: 2
INFO: 2018-04-17 13:05:47: web.py:1510 * 140329485150016 Timer: {'postprocess_last_status_None': 0, 'get_next_question': 4}
INFO: 2018-04-17 13:05:47: web.py:1510 * 140329485150016 logstash###...
INFO: 2018-04-17 13:05:47: web.py:2064 * 140329485150016 200 POST /which_drug_bot_app (192.168.10.12) 22.06ms
```

The logging data tells all the code line numbers are in `web.py` which is not a actual code file.

**So my question is how to write the right logging information with cython ?**
title: How to log the right code line number?
